brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts the DNS server hierarchy. A DNS client initially contacts a local DNS server, which contacts a top-level domain server. The top-level domain server contacts the root DNS server.
The conversation bubble for the local DNS server (cisco.com) states: "I have the records for www.cisco.com, mail.cisco.com."
Top-level domain server (dot com, dot org, dot a u, dot c o) conversation bubble states: "I have records to find who knows about cisco.com, linksys.com."
Root DNS server conversation bubble states: "I have records to find who knows about: dot com, dot org, dot a u, dot c o."

Caption text: "A hierarchy of DNS servers contains the resource records that match names with addresses."
